title: England fans condemned as millions hear '10 German bombers' chant live on TV hours after London terror attack
text:
England fans condemned as millions hear '10 German bombers' chant live on TV hours after London terror attack The friendly encounter in Dortmund went ahead hours after the devastating attacks at Parliament Hill in Westminster Share There is no suggestion those in the image were chanting (Photo: PA) Share     
England fans have been condemned after shameful chants during their friendly with Germany. 
The Three Lions play the world champions in Dortmund in Gareth Southgate's first game since taking permanent charge. 
The encounter went ahead just hours after the devastating terror attack in London on Wednesday. 
A section of the travelling England support were heard singing the long-standing '10 German bombers' chant throughout the first-half. 
The shameful chant has been used by Three Lions fans for years, in reference to World War II. England fans watch on - there is no suggestion those in the image were involved (Photo: REUTERS) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Footage shot from parliament after Westminster terror attack Share this video Watch Next 
On this occasion, the chants were slammed having been heard by millions back home live on TV. 
It has been suggested they are of particular poor taste given the incident at Parliament. 
One user suggested England fans should be 'showing a bit of a class' with another adding the chant "beggars belief". 
It was also questioned if the Three Lions fans could have avoided the chant on "today of all days". 
The FA have confirmed their plans to pay tribute to those affected by the attack at England's clash with Lithuania on Sunday. 
"Our thoughts are with all of those who have been affected by this terrible incident," FA chairman Clarke said ahead of the match in Dortmund. 
"We will be recognising the bravery of the security services and all those involved at the England vs Lithuania match on Sunday." England boss Gareth Southgate (Photo: The FA via Getty) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
